results.name: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,k) = t(n,2k+1) for 0 <= k <= n, T(n,n)=1, t given by A027926, n >= 0.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n-k} binomial(n-j, 2*(n-k-j) -1) with T(n,n)=1 in the region n >= 0, 0 <= k <= n. - _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
program: for(n=0,12, for(k=0,n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
(MAGMA) T:= func< n,k | k eq n select 1 else &+[Binomial(n-j, 2*(n-k-j) -1): j in [0..n-k]] >;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
else: return sum(binomial(n-j, 2*(n-k-j)-1) for j in (0..n-k))
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
Flat(List([0..12], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Sep 29 2019
xref: The row sums of this (slightly extended) bisection of the "Fibonacci array" A027926 are powers of 2, see A027935 for the other bisection.
